Function reference

Setting up and train models

Key functions for setting up models and training them. Start with distribution and see examples how to build a model.

distribution()
Create distribution modelling procedure
priors()
Creates a new PriorList object
BREGPrior()
Create a new spike and slab prior for Bayesian generalized linear models
BREGPriors()
Helper function when multiple variables are supplied
BREGPrior()
Create a new spike and slab prior for Bayesian generalized linear models
BREGPriors()
Helper function when multiple variables are supplied
GDBPrior()
Create a new monotonic prior
GDBPriors()
Helper function when multiple variables are supplied
INLAPrior()
Create a new INLA prior
INLAPriors()
Helper function when multiple variables and types are supplied
STANPrior()
Create a new stan prior
STANPriors()
Helper function when multiple variables and types are supplied
XGBPrior()
Create a new monotonic prior
XGBPriors()
Helper function when multiple variables are supplied
add_priors()
Add priors to an existing distribution object
rm_priors()
Remove existing priors from an existing distribution object
train()
Train the model from a given engine

Add or modify data and parameters

Functions to add or modify data and parameters in existing objects.

add_biodiversity_poipa()
Add biodiversity point dataset to a distribution object (presence-absence)
add_biodiversity_poipo()
Add biodiversity point dataset to a distribution object (presence-only)
add_biodiversity_polpo()
Add biodiversity polygon dataset to a distribution object (presence-only)
add_constrain(<BiodiversityScenario>,< character>)
Add a constrain to an existing scenario
add_constrain_MigClim(<BiodiversityScenario>,< character>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< character>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< character>)
Add constrains to the modelled distribution projection through the MigClim approach
add_constrain_connectivity(<BiodiversityScenario>,< character>,< numeric>,< RasterLayer>)
Adds a connectivity constrain to a scenario object
add_constrain_dispersal(<BiodiversityScenario>,< character>,< numeric>)
Adds a dispersal constrain to a scenario object
add_latent_spatial()
Add latent spatial effect to the model equation
add_log()
Adds a log file to distribution object
add_offset_range()
Specify an offset object for a species
add_predictor_range()
Add a range of a species as predictor to a distribution object
add_predictors()
Add predictors to a Biodiversity distribution object
add_priors()
Add priors to an existing distribution object
set_priors()
Add priors to an existing distribution object
sel_predictors()
Select specific predictors from a distribution object For instance those previously selected
rm_predictors()
Remove specific predictors from a distribution object
rm_priors()
Remove existing priors from an existing distribution object

Engines

Statistical models used for estimation of species distributions.

engine_bart()
Engine for use of Bayesian Additive Regression Trees (BART)
engine_breg()
Engine for Bayesian regularized regression models
engine_gdb()
Use of Gradient Descent Boosting for model estimation
engine_inla()
Use INLA as engine
engine_inlabru()
Use inlabru as engine
engine_stan()
Use Stan as engine
engine_xgboost()
Engine for extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost)

Create spatial-temporal projections

Functions specifically for adding constrains and creating scenarios based on trained models.

scenario()
Create a new scenario based on trained model parameters
project(<BiodiversityScenario>,< logical>)
Project a fitted model to new covariates
add_constrain(<BiodiversityScenario>,< character>)
Add a constrain to an existing scenario
add_constrain_MigClim(<BiodiversityScenario>,< character>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< character>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< numeric>,< character>)
Add constrains to the modelled distribution projection through the MigClim approach
add_constrain_connectivity(<BiodiversityScenario>,< character>,< numeric>,< RasterLayer>)
Adds a connectivity constrain to a scenario object
add_constrain_dispersal(<BiodiversityScenario>,< character>,< numeric>)
Adds a dispersal constrain to a scenario object

Model summary and validation

Key functions to summarize, validate or extract information from trained models.

summary(<distribution>) summary(<DistributionModel>) summary(<PredictorDataset>)
Summarises a trained model or predictor object
validate(<ANY>,< character>,< sf>,< character>,< character>)
Validation of distribution object
similarity()
Calculate environmental similarity of reference datasets to predictors.
effects(<DistributionModel>)
Plot effects of trained model
partial()
Obtain partial effects of trained model
spartial()
Obtain spatial partial effects of trained model
threshold()
Threshold a continuous prediction to a categorical layer
ensemble(<ANY>)
Function to create an ensemble of multiple fitted models

Utility functions

Functions used by engines or spatial processing

is_comparable_raster()
Are rasters comparable?
explode_factorized_raster()
Split raster factor levels to stack
posterior_predict_stanfit()
Create a posterior prediction from a rstanfit object
run_stan()
Fit cmdstanr model and convert to rstan object
intersecting_extents()
Do extents intersect?
point_in_polygon()
Extract polygon data from intersecting point data
bbox2wkt()
Converts a bounding box to a Well Known Text (WKT) polygon
extent_expand()
Expand an extent by a certain number
alignRasters()
Align a Raster object to another by harmonizing geometry and extend.
emptyraster()
Create an empty rasterLayer based on a template
get_ngbvalue()
Function to extract nearest neighbour predictor values of provided points
predictor_transform()
Spatial adjustment of raster stacks
predictor_derivate()
Create spatial derivate of raster stacks
clean_rasterfile()
Clean up raster layer from disk
writeGeoTiff()
Saves a raster file in Geotiff format
writeNetCDF()
Save a raster stack to a netcdf file
create_pseudoabsence()
Create pseudo absence points over a raster dataset
find_correlated_predictors()
Filter a set of correlated predictors to fewer ones
find_subset_of_predictors()
Apply the adaptive best subset selection framework on a set of predictors
myLog()
Custom messaging function for scripts
polynominal_transform()
Create a polynomial transformation from coordinates
stan_check_cmd()
Checks whether cmdstanr is available and otherwise tries to install it
wrap_stanmodel()
Wrap a list with stan model code
write_stanmodel()
Write a cmdstanr model output to a specific file

Class definitions and methods

These pages document the packageâ€™s internal data structures and functions for manipulating themâ€”they contain information that is really only useful when adding new functionality to the package.

BiodiversityDataset-class
BiodiversityDataset prototype description
BiodiversityDatasetCollection-class
BiodiversityDatasetCollection super prototype description
BiodiversityDistribution-class
Biodiversity Distribution master class
BiodiversityScenario-class
Prototype for a biodiversity scenario from a trained model
DistributionModel-class
Prototype for the trained Model object
Engine-class
Engine prototype.
Prior-class
Base Prior class
PriorList-class
List of Priors supplied to an class
Settings-class
Prototype for model settings object
PredictorDataset-class
PredictorDataset prototype description
Log-class
Log prototype.

Miscellaneous functions

Other functions only relevant for development

as.Id()
As Id
ibis_options()
Print ibis options
is.Id() is.Waiver() is.formula() is.Raster()
Check whether a provided object is truly of a specific type
new_id()
Identifier
new_waiver()
Waiver
%>%
Pipe operator
